item.title: FriendSnap -Final Project-
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You are banned from posting web project on this forum for 3 months. You have shown time and time again you only steal code and claim it as your own. You can post another in 3 months if you made it yourself, but if that is not the case (and you do not give credit to the people that did make it), we may think about permanently banning you from posting projects on this forum.

item.title: FriendSnap -Final Project-
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

robonick8:

Okay so I have offically lost count on how many “projects” you have been working on. Kind of hard to believe that these are yours

I’m glad someone understand what I’m talking about.

@OP - Can you give us some proof of your work? You have really good ideas for your projects, but it doesn’t seem that you follow through on a lot of them. I’m interested in this Runescape Clicker that you’re talking about, because I’m working on something similar (RSPS Text-Based, check it out) but I’m afraid that I won’t be able to see it due to your lack of following through on projects.

Edit: I will admit that I don’t always follow my development threads and update the change log, but the projects that I start I finish and move them to an external hard drive. My projects are usually for the experience.

Read full topic

item.title: FriendSnap -Final Project-
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

This doesn’t seem to be your work. With all these grammatical errors I don’t find you being capable of completing work like this. Along with other projects, and where did this project come from? Completely random.

Grammatical errors:
I*
Released*
Eight*
Days*
I* (again)
Launched*
I* (3rd time)

Anyhow, if you did this project yourself, I give you props.

Edit: Looking through your projects I saw a thread that you created only three to four months ago in which you were asking for help on creating a guessing game. You also stated that you didn’t know how to do it using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or PHP. A guessing game is quite honestly the easiest it gets. Hmmm.

Read full topic
